inclusion.criterion: Moderate aortic stenosis confirmed in the past 3 months by standard echocardiographic evaluation: aortic valve area >1.0 cm2 plus either maximal velocity 3.0-3.9 m/s or mean gradient 20-39 mmHg
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ability to undergo exercise stress testing
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Ability to understand and the willingness to provide written informed consent
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any hemodynamic criterion for severe AS: maximal velocity >= 4 m/s, mean gradient >= 40mmHg, aortic valve area =< 1 cm2
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Percutaneous coronary intervention or coronary artery bypass grafting in the past three months, or have revascularization planned in the near future
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Known, unrevascularized, and severe coronary artery disease (for example a 90% diameter stenosis or FFR<0.7 in the proximal left anterior descending artery)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Unicuspid, bicuspid, or non-calcified aortic valve observed during echocardiography
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Severe aortic regurgitation, mitral valve disease, tricuspid regurgitation, or a significant intracardiac shunt
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Co-existing hypertrophic cardiomyopathy or severe septal hypertrophy >15mm
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has moderate aortic stenosis, impaired left ventricular function, and no known coronary artery disease. However, the patient's bicuspid aortic valve may be a concern for exclusion.
